WRITING.TEXT: Except you can purchase an alarm clock. Or turn off your phone.
Ah yes the 'it's not an ACTUAL emergency unless it's my kid' argument. And yes, you have the legal right to live under a rock.

A kidnapping requires everyone to be vigilant in the moment. That's the purpose of Amber Alerts. The suggestion that to improve system is to get more people to ignore it is inane. This morning's incident woke me up and I'm 500 km away from where it happened, but I recognize searching for someone is complicated. This is the basic responsbility I have as you know a decent person. You're more than welcome to criticize the system, but don't cry victim of the mob when you get criticized back.
Spoken like a true victim. I hope you somehow recover from those sirens.
Don't you see? They're trying to 'improve' it by getting more people to ignore it.
Gaslighting is not an argument. Anyway, I don't think you can be persuaded, but happy to know you'll be woken up like me for future Amber Alerts. Sleep tight!

WRITING.TITLE: Children agree not to get abducted after 8 PM so Amber Alert doesn #8217;t wake anyone up

WRITING.TEXT: Either you're exaggerating what was two buzzes on a cellphone and a text at 3 AM, or Canada is grossly unprepared for nuclear war.
Are you alright? Where did the Amber Alert hurt you?
Well that's the thing about abductions. We don't know exactly where they are until we find them, which is the point of waking someone up 3 hours away.
I couldn't agree more!
My ground search only turned up assholes complaining about the Amber Alert.
